intro: Arctotis auriculata var. melanocycla, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets surrounding a dark, central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and a compact, bushy growth habit. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
